title: Raiders shut down DE Crosby, who leaves facility
content: The Raiders informed defensive end Maxx Crosby that he will sit out against the Giants because of a knee injury. After being told of the decision, Crosby left the team's facility.

title: Inoue, Nakatani win to set up 2026 megafight
content: Japanese boxing stars Naoya Inoue and Junto Nakatani won their respective fights to set up a 2026 showdown between two of the world's best pound-for-pound fighters.

title: Packers rule out Love, will start Willis vs. Ravens
content: Packers quarterback Jordan Love has been ruled out against the Ravens as he continues to deal with a concussion. Malik Willis will start for Green Bay.

title: Knueppel limps off with ankle injury; X-rays clean
content: Hornets rookie Kon Knueppel left Friday night's win over the Magic with a first-half ankle injury and will be reevaluated.

title: Garrett eyes sack record vs. 'legendary' Rodgers
content: Defensive end Myles Garrett says it would be "special" to set the NFL's single-season sack record against "legendary" quarterback Aaron Rodgers when the Browns and Steelers square off Sunday in Cleveland.

title: Pats down 5 starters, but Henderson might play
content: The Patriots will be without five starters against the Jets, but there is still a chance rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson is available as he progresses through the concussion protocol.

title: What you need to know for every NFL game in Week 17 -- including fantasy tips, playoff implications, predictions
content: Seahawks vs. Panthers. Jalen Hurts vs. Josh Allen. Picks, predictions and more for every remaining Week 17 game.

title: 'Is it a real functional toaster?': Behind the scramble to engineer the Pop-Tarts Bowl trophy
content: How the internet's favorite bowl took things to the next level by making its trophy a kitchen appliance.

title: 'It's a crazy story': Why Raiders' Alex Bachman lives in a guesthouse and has no attachments
content: Alex Bachman once found his locker empty before game day. Now he lives by rentals and no attachments.

title: For a team on top of Premier League table, Arsenal haven't looked convincing enough
content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for their fourth straight match, and it's not as convincing as it should be from the team topping the Premier League.

title: Packers' playoff hopes could hinge on special teams
content: Special teams remains an issue in Green Bay and played a key role in the loss to the Bears this past week.

title: Matthew Stafford vs. Drake Maye: Inside the odds, betting for the NFL's MVP race
content: Doug Greenberg goes inside the betting lines about the NFL MVP award, and Pamela Maldonado offers her best bet.

title: Giants-Raiders loser could be big winner in NFL draft
content: There is a lot at stake for two 2-13 teams -- namely, the pole position for the No. 1 overall pick in the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Christmas Day and all of Week 17
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Burrow gifts offensive linemen authentic dinosaur, bear and mammoth fossils for Christmas
content: Burrow's love of fossils gained national acclaim because of a clip from the Netflix series "Quarterback," where he was pumped to see fossils at Chicago's Field Museum.

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: A new United States champ; Three Stages of Hell for Rhodes vs. McIntyre
content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United consider re-signing midfielder Garner
content: Former Manchester United midfielder James Garner is being targeted for a return to Old Trafford. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: How U.S. Soccer can grow the game with $100 million World Cup windfall
content: The U.S. Soccer Federation is expecting to earn $100 million from co-hosting next summer's World Cup, so how will that money be invested in the game?

title: Colton Herta's adaptation to F2 could define IndyCar's global reputation
content: Colton Herta left IndyCar for F2 in hopes of moving up to F1. Whether he succeeds could determine how the world views the American open-wheel series.

title: Case Under Anti-Child Abuse Act Can't Be Dismissed If Victim Turns Hostile: Court
content: The Delhi High Court has upheld the jail term of a man for raping his minor stepdaughter, observing that guilt under the POCSO Act cannot be dismissed merely because the victim turned hostile, particularly when scientific evidence was available.

title: Cloth Left Inside Woman During Delivery At Greater Noida Hospital: Police
content: An FIR has been lodged against doctors of a private hospital in Greater Noida, besides senior health officials, after a women alleged that a half-metre-long surgical cloth had been left inside her abdomen during a delivery procedure in 2023.

title: Kerala Capital Thiruvananthapuram 'Omitted' From Rail Upgrade List, Shashi Tharoor Writes To Centre
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor slammed the alleged omission of the Kerala capital from the 48 major cities' infrastructure upgrade initiative announced by the Ministry of Railways as part of the Vision 2030

title: 'All Of India Concerned': Congress Condemns Attacks On Minorities In Bangladesh
content: Mallikarjun Kharge condemned the attacks on Hindu minorities in Bangladesh and said that the whole of India is concerned about it.

title: More Indians Deported From Saudi Arabia Than US In Five Years
content: Despite the immigration crackdown in the US, Saudi Arabia has deported more Indians than America, according to data provided by the Foreign Ministry.

title: IndiGo Cancels 57 Flights Due To 'Bad Weather' At Multiple Airports
content: Domestic carrier IndiGo on Saturday cancelled 57 flights across its network, citing "bad weather" at various airports, according to the airline's website.

title: Army Launches Operation To Pin Down Jaish Commander, Aide In J&K: Sources
content: The Indian Army has been carrying out an operation for the last one week in Jammu and Kashmir to pin down Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terrorists including its local commander Saifullah, his aide Adil and others, sources said.

title: Student Killed For Objecting To Racial Slurs, Body Brought Back To Tripura
content: Tripura was engulfed in grief and anger on Saturday as the body of a young tribal student, who died after being brutally attacked in Uttarakhand's Dehradun district, was brought back to the state.

title: Why US Tech Giants Are Betting $67.5 Billion On India's AI, Data Centre Boom
content: US technology giants are investing huge amounts of money into India as the country positions itself at the centre of the global hub for data centres and artificial intelligence infrastructure.

title: China Issues Draft Rules To Regulate Human-Like AI Systems
content: China's cyber regulator on Saturday issued draft rules for public comment that would tighten oversight of artificial intelligence services designed to simulate human personalities and engage users in emotional interaction.

title: US Strikes Targeted ISIS, Lakurawa Jihadists: Nigeria
content: US strikes in Nigeria this week targeted Islamic State militants from the Sahel who were in the country to work with the Lakurawa jihadist group and "bandit" gangs, a spokesman for the Nigerian president told AFP Saturday.

title: Russia Claims It Destroyed 111 Ukrainian Drones In 3 Hours
content: Russia's Defence Ministry said its air defence systems had intercepted and destroyed 111 Ukrainian drones in three hours over six Russian regions, including eight over Moscow.

title: Arrested For Theft, Man Dies By Suicide In Police Lockup In Gurugram: Cops
content: An man arrested in a theft case alleged died by suicide, hanging himself in the lockup of the crime unit in Farrukhnagar, police said on Saturday.

title: Gautam Adani To Inaugurate AI Centre In Baramati Tomorrow
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani will inaugurate the Sharad Pawar Centre of Excellence in Artificial Intelligence in Baramati in Pune district on Sunday, centre officials said.

title: 'Regular Customer': Mumbai Police Search For Bollywood Actor's Brother In Drugs Case
content: The city police have launched a manhunt for an actor after identifying him as a "regular consumer" in a drug case.

title: Netanyahu To Meet Trump In US On Monday, His Fifth Visit In 2025
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will depart for the United States on Sunday and meet with President Donald Trump in Florida a day later, an Israeli official told AFP.

title: Restaurant Owner Lynched After Refusing Liquor, Cigarettes In Maharashtra
content: A restaurant owner was beaten to death by three persons, who were later apprehended, for allegedly refusing to give them liquor and cigarettes in Maharashtra's Latur district, police said on Saturday.

title: UP Woman Kills Husband, In-Laws Catch Her Cleaning Bloodstains From Floor
content: A woman allegedly hacked her husband to death with an axe after a drunken quarrel here in Bithoor area, police said on Saturday.

title: 173 Cops Injured In Violence In Assam's Karbi Anglong This Week
content: Altogether 173 security personnel, belonging to both Assam Police and CRPF, were injured in violence earlier this week in which two persons were killed in West Karbi Anglong district, police said on Saturday.

title: Protest In London Against Killings Of Hindus In Bangladesh
content: Members of the Indian and Bangladeshi Hindu communities in London staged a protest outside the Bangladesh High Commission on Saturday against the killing of Hindus in Bangladesh.

title: V.V. Rajesh: Saffron entry
content: The BJP, which won its first Corporation election in Kerala, has chosen a familiar local face to be the Mayor of Thiruvananthapuram

title: Parties, public cry foul as SIR drive excludes lakhs of voters in Kerala
content: As debate rages over the reported exclusion of around 24 lakh voters from the draft voters’ list of Kerala, after the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls, Tiki Rajwi takes a closer look at the process to understand the concerns raised by both voters and political parties.

title: M.P. Congress media head quits amid discontent rumours; party declines resignation
content: As per party insiders, Mr. Nayak, a former State Cabinet Minister, is believed to be upset after a 13-member talent hunt committee appointed by him was cancelled by MPCC general secretary (media and communication)

title: Supreme Court special bench to hear suo motu case on  ‘definition’ of Aravalli
content: A three-judge Special Vacation Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant will hear the matter.

title: Bihar BJP President Saraogi meets Shah and Nadda in Delhi
content: It was Mr. Saraogi’s first meeting with Mr. Shah and Mr. Nadda after being appointed as state president earlier this month. He also met Bihar in-charge Vinod Tawde.

title: Tharoor criticises Thiruvananthapuram’s omission from Railway’s ’Vision 2030’, writes to Centre
content: The MP highlights the city’s strategic and operational prominence within the Southern Railway network in letter to Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Presidents, vice-presidents elected to panchayats across Kerala
content: The Congress-led United Democratic Front and the CPI(M)-led Left Democratic Front win control of seven district panchayats each. In some of the hung panchayats, parties such as the Social Democratic Party of India, Welfare Party and Twenty20 extend support to candidates of major alliances in the election of presidents and vice-presidents

title: T.N.’s growth under DMK government has drawn nation’s attention: Stalin
content: Even Union Ministers are spreading hatred against the State as they could not tolerate its growth; they believe they can secure votes in northern States by targeting Tamil Nadu, says Chief Minister

title: Congress shedding crocodile tears on rural jobs scheme: Chouhan
content: It used Mahatma Gandhi’s name for electoral gains, reduced the budget for MGNREGA and froze wages, alleges Agriculture Minister

title: The Hindu Impact: Minister seeks report on Wildlife First objections to KIOCL forest clearance plea
content: The directive follows a report published by The Hindu on December 24, 2025, which highlighted Wildlife First’s appeal to the Karnataka government to reject KIOCL’s application for retrospective forest clearance.

title: Looking back 2025: The Hindu’s most viewed cartoons
content: A collection of cartoons from The Hindu addressing key political events and controversies in India and abroad from 2025

title: Harassment of Kashmiris in other states is matter of national security: Sajad Lone
content: Mr. Lone urged Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Chief Minister Omar Abdullah to intervene in the matter

title: Bangladesh participation uncertain in Kolkata International Book Fair amid clearance issue
content: Publishers and Booksellers Guild say they cannot offer or allot stalls to publishers from Bangladesh until MEA clearance

title: Buon Natale rally turns Thrissur into a living canvas of Christmas joy
content: Over 15,000 Santas participate in the festive procession, blending faith, culture, technology and charity

title: Universal depression screening at primary care level could yield major health, economic gains: Lancet study
content: The study examines the feasibility and cost-effectiveness of integrating population-based depression screening into India’s comprehensive primary healthcare system

title: Unnao rape case: survivor approaches CBI seeking FIR against Investigative Officer for 'colluding' with Sengar
content: In her complaint, the victim alleged that the investigating officer conducted the probe dishonestly, and in such a way that Senger and other accused may get benefits of “deliberate lapses, manipulation of facts introduced, and secure a favourable outcome”

title: Anti-social behaviour will not be tolerated, says A.P. Home Minister
content: Anitha criticises YSRCP activists for sacrificing animals during the birthday celebrations of Jagan Mohan Reddy

title: Vizag steel plant rightful asset of Andhra Pradesh people, says TPCC leader
content: Jagga Reddy says Congress built and safeguarded the public sector unit and alleges attempts by the Centre to privatise it

title: Installation of rooftop solar power plants being expedited in Rajasthan
content: The exercise, carried out under the revamped distribution sector scheme, along with installation of meters on transformers, is aimed at reducing transmission and distribution losses and improve power supply quality.

title: Sanchara Yukta project may add 90 km of roads beyond GBA limits; plans to widen Wind Tunnel Road
content: Under the Sanchara Yukta project, the government plans to build roads along the buffer zones of storm-water drains and lakes in the city to address growing congestion by expanding the road network

title: CM, DyCM to meet high command after January 6
content: Chief Minister says Congress will launch a protest in the State from January 5 as a part of the nationwide stir, opposing the newly enacted VB-G Ram G

title: Mary Thomas, T.K. Sudheesh take oath as Thrissur district panchayat president, vice-president
content: LDF candidates secure decisive victories in district body elections; formal oath-taking ceremony graced by Ministers, officials, and political leaders

title: Sheela Stephen elected Idukki district panchayat president
content: UDF’s T.S. Siddique is the vice-president. Kerala Congress’s Sheela will hold the post for a year, while Congress nominee Mini Sabu will be in charge for the remaining four years of the term

title: Special camps for draft electoral roll revisions begin in three districts
content: Applications received will be verified by relevant officers and action will be taken to include names in the final voter list to be released in February

title: Kakatiya University Pharma faculty lauded for bringing global recognition to department
content: An alumnus of KU Pharmacy Department, former director of the U.S. FDA Mansoor Khan, recalled the humble beginnings of the college with limited facilities and credited disciplined teachers and peer support for shaping successful careers

title: Congress to form monitoring cells to assist governing committees in local bodies where it is in power
content: The monitoring cells will include senior party leaders, those with administrative experience, and retired officials from local institutions, says DCC chief

title: Thousands witness Mandala puja at Sabarimala
content: Sabarimala Ayyappa  temple will be closed on the night of December 27, marking the culmination of the Mandala puja season, and will open at 5 p.m. on December 30 for the Makaravilakku festival

title: Little KITEs camps: 15,000 students to develop weather models in Kerala
content: Students are learning the scientific methods behind modern weather determination and the functioning of weather forecasting centres

title: No loss of land due to cricket stadium project, claims SSUS
content: The V-C accuses the Save University Campaign Committee of launching a misleading campaign against the project

title: TMC accuses Suvendu Adhikari of ‘naked hate speech’ in his remarks against Bangladesh
content: There was, ‘No FIR. no arrest. No prosecution. No UAPA slapped..,” on the BJP leader for his remarks, West Bengal’s ruling party also said

title: KLU students urged to help eradicate corruption
content: Students should aim for a good career rather than just having a job, says NASI president during the institute’s 15 convocation programme

title: Towards bettering the ‘Vaikuntha Ekadasi’ darshan system in Tirumala
content: Till 2018, it was the regular two-day affair, but, in a novel experiment from December 25, 2020, the TTD had emulated the Srirangam temple format of keeping the threshold open for 10 days, which led to higher footfalls

title: Naidu praises NTR institutions for shaping future leaders
content: He highlights the Trust’s role in education, social service and student achievements under Nara Bhuvaneswari’s leadership

title: As SRV school turns 180 , its glorious legacy is in peril
content: The decline in the number of students marks more than a mere fall from grace for a school that, until the 1990s, boasted thousands of students spread across multiple divisions in each grade

title: Army intensifies winter counter-terror operations in J&K during Chillai Kalan
content: It has established temporary bases and surveillance posts deep inside snow-covered terrain to maintain continuous pressure on potential terrorist hideouts.

title: 13 booked as Jagan’s birthday celebrations trigger ‘public outrage’ in A.P.
content: Police receive complaints about YSRCP cadres performing animal sacrifices in full public view and smearing photo of the YSRCP president with blood

title: Safety measures to be in place for smooth conduct of Cochin Carnival
content: Maximum number of police personnel will be deployed for keeping law and order. Strict action will be taken against stalls that fail to adhere to safety guidelines

title: Officers’ association warns of boycott over Bihar Minister’s conduct
content: Remarks made by Deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha for some time have not only deeply damaged the dignity of the State’s revenue administration but have also made an entire service cadre the subject of public ridicule and outrage, BiRSA stated in a letter to the CM

title: Why did ECI appoint micro observers in Bengal when State has the lowest voter deletions in SIR, asks Abhishek Banerjee
content: Asks the Election Commission to publish a list of names in the logical discrepancy voters’ category and the list of alleged infiltrators; he will head to New Delhi on December 31 to question EC officials in person

title: CPDCL snaps power supply to Kanaka Durga temple in Vijayawada citing non-payment of ₹3.08 crore dues
content: After discussions, supply has been fully restored in and around the temple premises, says Executive Officer  Seena Nayak

title: Preacher Dhirendra Shastri using government aircraft kicks up a storm
content: A police officer in uniform is seen removing his cap and shoes before proceeding to touch the religious preacher’s feet; Congress alleged misuse of public money

title: How India's economy defied odds in 2025 — but external shocks left a mark
content: India's economy demonstrated remarkable resilience in 2025, achieving 8.2% GDP growth amidst global trade wars and tariffs. A rare 'Goldilocks' phase of low inflation and accommodative monetary policy, coupled with GST 2.0 and tax relief, bolstered domestic demand. The year concluded with mixed stock market trends,  record FIIs, rupee pressure and tariffs highlighting ongoing global uncertainties.

title: Aravali mining row: Supreme Court takes suo motu cognisance; hearing set for Monday
content: The Supreme Court has taken suo motu cognisance of concerns regarding the definition of the Aravali Range, which has sparked debate over mining and environmental protection. A three-judge bench will hear the matter, as environmentalists fear the current definition could weaken conservation efforts for the ancient mountain system.

title: UK: Khalistanis counter-protest Hindus outside Bangladesh high commission in London
content: London witnessed a Hindu protest against the lynching of Dipu Das and persecution in Bangladesh, disrupted by Khalistani demonstrators. Over 500 Hindus demanded justice for Das and protection for minorities, highlighting centuries of oppression. The peaceful Hindu gathering was met with anti-India and anti-Hindu slogans from the counter-protestors, prompting police intervention.

title: Brace for fog chaos on Sunday: IndiGo cancels flights; AI issues travel advisory
content: IndiGo has cancelled 13 flights on Sunday due to forecasted bad weather and operational reasons, impacting major city routes. This follows earlier cancellations due to pilot duty norms and stricter fog operating rules. Air India also warned of potential disruptions in northern India due to dense fog.

title: AI rewrites coding norms: Ex-Tesla AI director warns programmers are falling behind; sparks debate
content: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic remain optimistic about AI's role in development.

title: Unnao rape case: SC to hear CBI plea against Sengar's bail on Dec 29; what survivor told agency
content: The Supreme Court will hear the CBI's appeal against the Delhi high court's decision to suspend former BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar's life sentence in the Unnao rape case. This comes after the survivor alleged the investigating officer colluded with a judge to ensure Sengar's victory, days after his bail was granted.

title: CM vs CM: Sidda takes on Pinarayi over 'bulldozer' remark; defends eviction drive
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has strongly refuted Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan's "North Indian bulldozer justice" accusation regarding a Bengaluru eviction drive. Siddaramaiah termed Vijayan's remarks politically motivated and lacking factual understanding, emphasizing the lawful removal of illegal encroachments.

title: Google CEO shares AI-made Xmas photo: Elon Musk reacts; post goes viral
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai's AI-generated Christmas greeting featuring himself and his dog, Jeffree, in a custom snow globe image, garnered significant attention on X.

title: Mirwaiz bio change controversy: Sajad Lone alleges surrender for protocol
content: Sajad Lone criticized Mirwaiz Umar Farooq's decision to remove his Hurriyat chairman title from X, calling it a "surrender for protocol and security." Lone accused the cleric of double standards, recalling past vilification. Mirwaiz cited UAPA bans and restricted communication as reasons for his "Hobson's choice." PDP and NC supported Mirwaiz, blaming authorities.

title: U19 World Cup: Mhatre to lead India; Sooryavanshi named captain for SA tour
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi will captain India's U-19 team on their South Africa tour, with Ayush Mhatre set to lead the squad for the 2026 U-19 World Cup in Zimbabwe and Namibia. Injuries have ruled out Mhatre and Vihaan Malhotra from the South Africa leg, but they are expected to return for the World Cup.

title: China’s new export rules: Silver prices soar; 'this is not good', says Elon Musk
content: Elon Musk voiced concerns over rising silver prices as China's new export rules approach.  Starting January 1, 2026, China will restrict silver exports, requiring licenses for companies. This, coupled with a structural supply deficit and collapsing physical inventories, is driving a real supply squeeze, impacting industrial demand for critical sectors like EVs and solar panels.

title: Stephen Curry responds to backlash over Ayesha Curry’s marriage remarks
content: Stephen Curry and his wife, Ayesha Curry, have been getting brutally trolled over the last few months, ever since she made some controversial remarks about their marriage. As the couple continues to get trolled, Stephen Curry has finally broken his silence on it as he addressed the hate his wife receives on a regular basis.

title: Love or other motive?: Bangladeshi youth crosses border to ‘meet girlfriend’; arrested
content: A 25-year-old Bangladeshi national, Rayhan Kabir, was arrested in Basirhat, India, after illegally crossing the border to meet a woman he met on social media. He was apprehended by locals due to suspicious behavior and subsequently detained by police for failing to produce valid documents. Kabir has been remanded in judicial custody for 14 days as investigations continue.

title: Standoff outside B'desh mission in UK: Khalistanis disrupt stir by Hindus over killings - watch
content: Indian and Bangladeshi ​​Hindus were outside the Bangladesh High Commission in London on Saturday when a handful of Khalistanis showed up outside in support of Bangladesh. Shattered by horrific lynchings of Dipu Chandra Das and Amrit Mondal, trapped and persecuted Hindus in Bangladesh are sending out an SOS to India to open the borders to escape Islamist mob fury.

title: Brittany Mahomes shifts focus as Patrick Mahomes earns praise off the field
content: NFL titans Robert Kraft and Gayle Benson, both billionaires, showcase contrasting paths to sports ownership. Kraft built a vast empire through diverse investments before acquiring the Patriots, while Benson inherited and expanded her late husband's franchises, the Saints and Pelicans. Their financial journeys highlight distinct strategies for wealth accumulation and franchise management.

title: Frank Lampard & Christine Lampard net worth 2025: Football, TV success
content: Former Chelsea star Frank Lampard, a decorated player and manager, has achieved significant success in football. His wife, Christine Lampard, is a highly recognized and versatile TV presenter. Despite their public profiles, the couple prioritizes their children, maintaining a combined net worth estimated at £100 million through their respective careers and investments.

title: Elliotte Friedman warns Maple Leafs face tough talks amid inconsistency
content: The Toronto Maple Leafs are going through a rough patch with inconsistent performances and growing pressure on leadership. Elliotte Friedman has said the team needs to act quickly to improve consistency and accountability. How the Leafs play in the coming games will show if they can get back on track and avoid a difficult stretch this season.

title: J&K: CBI lawyer killed in highway crash; accused driver arrested
content: Tragedy struck on the Srinagar-Jammu highway as CBI prosecutor Sheikh Adil Nabi, 35, lost his life in a collision near Banihal. His car was struck from behind by a speeding Scorpio. Police have apprehended the Scorpio's driver, Mohammad Shafi, in connection with the incident.

title: Protest held outside Jammu Lok Bhavan over MBBS admission row
content: Protesters in Jammu demanded the cancellation of MBBS admissions at SMVDIME, citing that 42 out of 50 seats went to Muslim candidates. Activists, joined by BJP members and trade leaders, argued for Hindu-only reservations. The Sangharsh Samiti vows to continue the protest until their demands, linked to faith, are met.

title: 'No matter what': Former India batter backs Samson to open in T20 World Cup
content: "Sanju Samson should be a starter in the T20 World Cup eleven, no matter what. And I will tell you why. So Sanju Samson is amongst the hundred makers post T20 World Cup 2024. In South Africa, he got back-to-back hundreds and then Bangladesh. (He) Motivated young stars who also put their hands up – if Sanju can score one hundred, I could score as well," Uthappa said.

title: J&K students association says another Kashmiri shawl seller assaulted
content: A Kashmiri shawl seller suffered severe injuries, including fractures, after an alleged assault in Himachal Pradesh. The J&K Students Association condemned the incident, marking it as the 16th targeting Kashmiri traders in the state this year. They urged the Himachal CM for immediate action. A similar harassment case in Haryana is also being addressed.

title: 'IO colluded with ...': Unnao rape survivor's explosive charge; meets CBI officials
content: Unnao rape victim alleges the investigating officer colluded with the judge, aiming to break her spirit and halt her pursuit of justice. This accusation follows the Delhi High Court's decision to grant bail to convict Kuldeep Singh Sengar, suspending his life sentence.

title: J&K: Bilal Lone backs Mirwaiz, terms X bio barbs as ‘dishonest, dangerous'
content: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq faced criticism for removing his Hurriyat chairman title from X, but received backing from Bilal Gani Lone. Lone defended the Mirwaiz, highlighting his personal sacrifices and courage. This support contrasts with criticism from Sajad Lone, who alleged a 'surrender' for security. The debate highlights internal divisions within Kashmiri leadership.

title: Happy new year 2026: Top 50 Wishes, quotes to share with your loved ones
content: As December concludes, the world anticipates New Year's Eve, a global celebration of fresh starts and renewed hope. Traditions vary, from Spain's 12 grapes to Denmark's plate-throwing, all emphasizing connection and togetherness. The article offers wishes and quotes to share this spirit of healing and opportunity.

title: On this day: How a 'hair transplant' pitch abandoned IND vs SL ODI
content: Despite lasting only 23.3 overs, the match saw a lot of action. There was a wicket off the first ball, a dropped catch off the first ball of the second over, several blows to the body, thick edges flying past third man, and wickets for Zaheer Khan, debutant Sudeep Tyagi and Harbhajan Singh.

title: Revealed: Kohli, Rohit's per-match earnings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's participation in the Vijay Hazare Trophy highlights the tournament's crucial role in India's domestic cricket.  Player earnings are tiered by experience, not stardom, with seasoned cricketers like Kohli and Sharma earning Rs 60,000 per match, a fraction of their international fees.  Daily allowances and performance-based awards supplement this income.

title: 'Santa reached police station': AAP flags Christmas 'violence, intimidation'; FIR lodged
content: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj highlighted incidents of violence and intimidation against Christmas celebrations nationwide, with Santa Claus reportedly filing an FIR against 'Right Wing goons'. Opposition parties criticized the BJP over alleged disruptions and attacks on Christian communities in states like Madhya Pradesh, Kerala, and Chhattisgarh.

title: 'India must change stand': Hindus form party in B'desh; hope to win 40-45 seats in polls
content: A newly registered Bangladesh Minority Janta Party (BMJP) aims to contest 91 seats in the upcoming elections, targeting Hindu and minority votes. The party's president seeks alliances with mainstream parties like BNP or Jamaat-e-Islami to ensure minority safety and participation, advocating for a secular Bangladesh and protection of Hindu rights.

title: Zepto files draft IPO papers with Sebi: Rs 11,000 cr issue planned for next year
content: Quick e-commerce firm Zepto has filed preliminary papers with SEBI for an IPO, aiming to raise Rs 11,000 crore. The company, founded by Stanford dropouts, is utilizing a confidential filing route for its planned stock market debut next year. Zepto's move follows successful listings of rivals Zomato and Swiggy.

title: Message for Cong? Digvijaya shares old photo of Modi at RSS event - what he said
content: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh praised the RSS's organizational strength, highlighting how grassroots workers rise to leadership. He later clarified his support for 'sangathan' (organization) but remained opposed to the RSS and Prime Minister Modi. Singh also urged Rahul Gandhi to implement internal reforms within the Congress, drawing parallels with his push for Election Commission reforms.

title: 'Save us, open borders': Hindus send SOS from B'desh; attacks on minorities rising
content: Hindus in Bangladesh are pleading with India to open its borders, fearing escalating violence and persecution following recent lynchings.  Concerns are heightened by the potential return of a hardline BNP leader, with minorities feeling trapped and vulnerable.  Activists criticize Indian Hindu organizations for inaction, warning of a potential 'holocaust' if borders remain closed.

title: Steve Smith scripts history, now second only to Don Bradman in this list
content: Steve Smith has become Australia's second highest run-scorer against England in Ashes history. He surpassed Allan Border during the recent Test match. Smith's consistent performance over many Ashes contests places him in elite company. The match itself was a low-scoring affair dominated by bowlers on a challenging pitch. England ultimately secured a victory in a closely fought contest.

title: Between two Indias: Life on the 2025 feed
content: In 2025, the Indian "scroll" is a journey through two worlds on one screen: a filtered India of aesthetic luxury and a raw India of everyday labor. As affordable data and smartphones bring 500 million users online—mostly from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities—the distance between these lives has collapsed.

title: 'Hate for Dalit': BJP attacks Cong over Kharge's treatment in presser - watch video
content: The BJP has accused the Gandhi-Vadra family of open hatred towards Dalits, citing an incident where Jairam Ramesh allegedly directed Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge to read a note aloud. This comes as Congress announced nationwide protests against the alleged replacement of MGNREGA with the 'VB G Ram G Act', which they deem an insult to Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Skywatching in 2026 with eclipses, supermoons, meteor showers and Artemis II
content: Get ready for a celestial spectacle in 2026! Witness a 'ring of fire' solar eclipse, a deep red lunar eclipse, and a rare Blue Moon.  The year culminates with a spectacular total solar eclipse paired with the Perseid meteor shower, plus a supermoon on Christmas Eve. Don't miss NASA's Artemis II lunar mission!

title: 'Ball was just sitting in grass': Smith explains why no batter could settle on MCG deck
content: "It probably started quite slow and it's hard to explain. Not tennis bally normally, that's from like the moisture of the wicket," Smith said during the post-match press conference. He added that the thickness of the grass affected how the ball behaved after pitching.

title: DSSSB exams postponed as Delhi considers raising age limit for teacher recruitment posts
content: The Delhi government has postponed the DSSSB examinations scheduled for March as it reviews demands to raise the maximum age limit for candidates. The decision follows protests by aspirants who missed earlier exams due to age restrictions caused by delayed recruitment. Education Minister Ashish Sood said the move aims to ensure fairness and fill long-pending vacancies in schools and departments. New exam dates will be announced after age relaxation is finalised.

title: 'Grateful forever': Spinner who got Kohli’s wicket shares emotional post
content: Virat Kohli played a strong innings of 77 for Delhi against Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Gujarat spinner Vishal Jayswal took Kohli's wicket. After the match, Jayswal shared a memorable moment with Kohli, receiving an autograph and a photograph. Kohli had previously scored 131 in the tournament. He is not expected to play further matches.

title: New FDNY chief: Musk says people will die because of Mamdani’s choice; Sacks replies
content: Elon Musk has sparked controversy by warning that New York City's new Fire Department Commissioner, Lillian Bonsignore, lacks the necessary firefighting experience, predicting fatal consequences.  Bonsignore, a 31-year EMS veteran, is defended by Mayor-elect Mamdani, who highlights EMS's growing role and the Commissioner's managerial focus. Tech figures like David Sacks have echoed Musk's concerns.

title: Mikel Arteta & Lorena Bernal net worth 2025: Manager salary, media, investments
content: Mikel Arteta's journey from Premier League player to Arsenal head coach has yielded significant financial rewards, with his $25 million net worth primarily from his managerial salary and bonuses. His wife, Lorena Bernal, a former Miss Spain and actress, contributes an estimated $5-$10 million to their combined wealth of $30-$35 million through her diverse career and investments.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: the transfer window opens in early January across the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A . but clubs have been busy planning their business for months . arsenal's summer spend was so comprehensive that they now have the best squad depth in England .

title: Why Laveranues Coles decided to give up his cushy retired life to become an officer
content: laveranues Coles was approached by an elderly woman, a shopper walking to her car . she had no idea he was one of the NFL's most productive wide receivers from 2000 to 2009 . "i feel safe with you here," she told Coles .
